Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

1 #include "KSNavSpace.h"

6 using namespace std;

8 namespace Kassiopeia
9 {

11  KSNavSpace::KSNavSpace() :
12  fEnterSplit( false ),
13  fExitSplit( false ),
14  fFailCheck( false ),
15  fCurrentTrajectory( NULL ),
16  fCurrentSpace( NULL ),
17  fParentSpace( NULL ),
18  fParentSpaceAnchor( 0., 0., 0. ),
19  fParentSpaceDistance( 0. ),
20  fParentSpaceRecalculate( true ),
21  fChildSpace( NULL ),
22  fChildSpaceAnchor( 0., 0., 0. ),
23  fChildSpaceDistance( 0. ),
24  fChildSpaceRecalculate( true ),
25  fParentSide( NULL ),
26  fParentSideAnchor( 0., 0., 0. ),
27  fParentSideDistance( 0. ),
28  fParentSideRecalculate( true ),
29  fChildSide( NULL ),
30  fChildSideAnchor( 0., 0., 0. ),
31  fChildSideDistance( 0. ),
32  fChildSideRecalculate( true ),
33  fChildSurface( NULL ),
34  fLastStepSurface( NULL ),
35  fChildSurfaceAnchor( 0., 0., 0. ),
36  fChildSurfaceDistance( 0. ),
37  fChildSurfaceRecalculate( true ),
38  fSpaceInsideCheck( true ),
39  fNavigationFail( false ),
40  fSolver(),
41  fIntermediateParticle()
42  {
43  }
44  KSNavSpace::KSNavSpace( const KSNavSpace& aCopy ) :
45  KSComponent(),
46  fEnterSplit( aCopy.fEnterSplit ),
47  fExitSplit( aCopy.fExitSplit ),
48  fFailCheck( aCopy.fFailCheck ),
49  fCurrentTrajectory( aCopy.fCurrentTrajectory ),
50  fCurrentSpace( aCopy.fCurrentSpace ),
51  fParentSpace( aCopy.fParentSpace ),
52  fParentSpaceAnchor( aCopy.fParentSpaceAnchor ),
53  fParentSpaceDistance( aCopy.fParentSpaceDistance ),
54  fParentSpaceRecalculate( aCopy.fParentSpaceRecalculate ),
55  fChildSpace( aCopy.fChildSpace ),
56  fChildSpaceAnchor( aCopy.fChildSpaceAnchor ),
57  fChildSpaceDistance( aCopy.fChildSpaceDistance ),
58  fChildSpaceRecalculate( aCopy.fChildSpaceRecalculate ),
59  fParentSide( aCopy.fParentSide ),
60  fParentSideAnchor( aCopy.fParentSideAnchor ),
61  fParentSideDistance( aCopy.fParentSideDistance ),
62  fParentSideRecalculate( aCopy.fParentSideRecalculate ),
63  fChildSide( aCopy.fChildSide ),
64  fChildSideAnchor( aCopy.fChildSideAnchor ),
65  fChildSideDistance( aCopy.fChildSideDistance ),
66  fChildSideRecalculate( aCopy.fChildSideRecalculate ),
67  fChildSurface( aCopy.fChildSurface ),
68  fLastStepSurface( aCopy.fLastStepSurface ),
69  fChildSurfaceAnchor( aCopy.fChildSurfaceAnchor ),
70  fChildSurfaceDistance( aCopy.fChildSurfaceDistance ),
71  fChildSurfaceRecalculate( aCopy.fChildSurfaceRecalculate ),
72  fSpaceInsideCheck( aCopy.fSpaceInsideCheck ),
73  fNavigationFail( aCopy.fNavigationFail ),
74  fSolver(),
75  fIntermediateParticle()
76  {
77  }
78  KSNavSpace* KSNavSpace::Clone() const
79  {
80  return new KSNavSpace( *this );
81  }
82  KSNavSpace::~KSNavSpace()
83  {
84  }

86  void KSNavSpace::SetEnterSplit( const bool& aEnterSplit )
87  {
88  fEnterSplit = aEnterSplit;
89  return;
90  }
91  const bool& KSNavSpace::GetEnterSplit() const
92  {
93  return fEnterSplit;
94  }

97  {
98  fExitSplit = aExitSplit;
99  return;
100  }
101  const bool& KSNavSpace::GetExitSplit() const
102  {
103  return fExitSplit;

106  void KSNavSpace::SetFailCheck( const bool& aValue )
107  {
108  fFailCheck = aValue;
109  return;
110  }
111  const bool& KSNavSpace::GetFailCheck() const
112  {
113  return fFailCheck;
114  }
115 
116  void KSNavSpace::CalculateNavigation( const KSTrajectory& aTrajectory, const KSParticle& aTrajectoryInitialParticle, const KSParticle& aTrajectoryFinalParticle, const KThreeVector& aTrajectoryCenter, const double& aTrajectoryRadius, const double& aTrajectoryStep, KSParticle& aNavigationParticle, double& aNavigationStep, bool& aNavigationFlag )
117  {
118  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> calculating navigation:" << eom );
119 
120  KSSpace* tCurrentSpace = aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
121  KThreeVector tInitialPoint = aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetPosition();
122  KThreeVector tFinalPoint = aTrajectoryFinalParticle.GetPosition();
123 
124  bool tSpaceFlag = false;
125  double tSpaceTime = numeric_limits< double >::max();
126  fParentSpace = NULL;
127  fChildSpace = NULL;
128 
129  bool tSideFlag = false;
130  double tSideTime = numeric_limits< double >::max();
131  fParentSide = NULL;
132  fChildSide = NULL;
133 
134  bool tSurfaceFlag = false;
135  double tSurfaceTime = numeric_limits< double >::max();
136  fChildSurface = NULL;
137 
138  double tTime = 0.0;
139  double tDistance = 0.0;
140  double tInitialIntersection = 0.0;
141  double tFinalIntersection = 0.0;
142  KSSpace* tSpace = NULL;
143  KSSurface* tSurface = NULL;
144  KSSide* tSide = NULL;
145 
146  navmsg_debug( " in space <" << tCurrentSpace->GetName() << "> at <" << aTrajectoryCenter.X() << ", " << aTrajectoryCenter.Y() << ", " << aTrajectoryCenter.Z() << "> with radius <" << aTrajectoryRadius << ">" << eom );
147 
148  if( tCurrentSpace != fCurrentSpace )
149  {
150  fCurrentSpace = tCurrentSpace;
151  fParentSideRecalculate = true;
152  fChildSideRecalculate = true;
153  fChildSurfaceRecalculate = true;
154  fParentSpaceRecalculate = true;
155  fChildSpaceRecalculate = true;
156  }
157 
158  fCurrentTrajectory = &aTrajectory;
159 
160  //check if particle is inside the space it should be (only if fail check is activated)
161  if ( fFailCheck && fSpaceInsideCheck )
162  {
163  if (tCurrentSpace->Outside( tInitialPoint ) )
164  {
165  navmsg( eWarning ) <<"initial point "<<tInitialPoint<<" of trajectory is not inside current space <"<<tCurrentSpace->GetName()<<">"<<eom;
166  fNavigationFail = true;
167  aNavigationStep = 0.0;
168  aNavigationFlag = true;
169  return;
170  }
171 
172  for( int tSpaceIndex = 0; tSpaceIndex < tCurrentSpace->GetSpaceCount(); tSpaceIndex++ )
173  {
174  tSpace = tCurrentSpace->GetSpace( tSpaceIndex );
175  if ( tSpace->Outside( tInitialPoint ) == false )
176  {
177  navmsg( eWarning ) <<"initial point "<<tInitialPoint<<" of trajectory should be in child space <"<<tSpace->GetName()<<">, but is not"<<eom;
178  fNavigationFail = true;
179  aNavigationStep = 0.0;
180  aNavigationFlag = true;
181  return;
182  }
183  }
184  }
185 
186  //**********
187  //space exit
188  //**********
189 
190  if( fParentSpaceRecalculate == false )
191  {
192  double tExcursion = (aTrajectoryCenter - fParentSpaceAnchor).Magnitude() + aTrajectoryRadius;
193  if( tExcursion >= fParentSpaceDistance )
194  {
195  navmsg_debug( " excursion from parent space anchor exceeds cached distance <" << fParentSpaceDistance << ">" << eom );
196  fParentSpaceRecalculate = true;
197  }
198  }
199  if( fParentSpaceRecalculate == true )
200  {
201  fParentSpaceAnchor = aTrajectoryCenter;
202  fParentSpaceDistance = numeric_limits< double >::max();
203  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to exit must be recalculated" << eom );
204 
205  do
206  {
207  tSpace = tCurrentSpace;
208 
209  // calculate the distance between the anchor and the exit space
210  tDistance = (fParentSpaceAnchor - tSpace->Point( fParentSpaceAnchor )).Magnitude();
211  navmsg_debug( " distance to parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
212 
213  // if the current distance is less than the current minimum distance replace the current minimum distance with the current distance
214  if( tDistance < fParentSpaceDistance )
215  {
216  fParentSpaceDistance = tDistance;
217  }
218 
219  // if this distance is greater than the trajectory radius, skip the parent space
220  if( tDistance > aTrajectoryRadius )
221  {
222  navmsg_debug( " skipping parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> because distance is greater than trajectory radius" << eom );
223  break;
224  }
225 
226  // calculate initial intersection
227  tInitialIntersection = ( tInitialPoint - tSpace->Point( tInitialPoint )).Dot( tSpace->Normal( tInitialPoint ) );
228  navmsg_debug( " initial intersection to parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tInitialIntersection << ">" << eom );
229 
230  // calculate final intersection
231  tFinalIntersection = ( tFinalPoint - tSpace->Point( tFinalPoint )).Dot( tSpace->Normal( tFinalPoint ) );
232  navmsg_debug( " final intersection to parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tFinalIntersection << ">" << eom );
233 
234  if( tFinalIntersection < 0 )
235  {
236  //final state is inside current space, no exit, skipping
237  navmsg_debug( " skipping parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> because final intersection function sign is negative" << eom );
238  break;
239  }
240  else if( tFinalIntersection > 0 )
241  {
242  //initial state inside, final state outside, default case for exiting
243 
244  double tLowerBoundary = 0.0;
245  if( tInitialIntersection > 0 )
246  {
247  // rare case that only happens if the space was just entered but the initial intersection is not zero but positive due to numerics
248  // and the space is smaller than the step size
249  // as two intersections exist for this case, the lower boundary is increased a little bit to get the second intersection,
250  // which is where the particle leaves the space
251  tLowerBoundary = aTrajectoryStep / 100.0;
252  }
253  // calculate intersection time
254  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSpace( tSpace );
255  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SpaceIntersectionFunction, 0., tLowerBoundary, aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
256  navmsg_debug( " time to parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
257  }
258  else if( tFinalIntersection == 0 )
259  {
260  //final state exactly on border of parent space, very rare case for exiting
261  tTime = aTrajectoryStep;
262  navmsg_debug( " time to parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
263  }
264 
265 
266 #ifdef Kassiopeia_ENABLE_DEBUG
267  // calculate intersection distance
268  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tTime, fIntermediateParticle );
269  tDistance = (fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() - tSpace->Point( fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() )).Magnitude();
270  navmsg_debug( " distance of calculated crossing position to parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
271 #endif
272 
273  tSpaceFlag = true;
274  tSpaceTime = tTime;
275  fParentSpace = tSpace;
276  fChildSpace = NULL;
277 
278  }
279  while( false );
280 
281  fParentSpaceRecalculate = false;
282  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to exit is <" << fParentSpaceDistance << ">" << eom );
283  }
284 
285  //***********
286  //space enter
287  //***********
288 
289  if( fChildSpaceRecalculate == false )
290  {
291  double tExcursion = (aTrajectoryCenter - fChildSpaceAnchor).Magnitude() + aTrajectoryRadius;
292  if( tExcursion >= fChildSpaceDistance )
293  {
294  navmsg_debug( " excursion from enter anchor exceeds cached distance <" << fChildSpaceDistance << ">" << eom );
295  fChildSpaceRecalculate = true;
296  }
297  }
298  if( fChildSpaceRecalculate == true )
299  {
300  fChildSpaceAnchor = aTrajectoryCenter;
301  fChildSpaceDistance = numeric_limits< double >::max();
302  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to enter must be recalculated" << eom );
303 
304  for( int tSpaceIndex = 0; tSpaceIndex < tCurrentSpace->GetSpaceCount(); tSpaceIndex++ )
305  {
306  tSpace = tCurrentSpace->GetSpace( tSpaceIndex );
307 
308  // calculate the distance between the anchor and the enter space
309  tDistance = (fChildSpaceAnchor - tSpace->Point( fChildSpaceAnchor )).Magnitude();
310  navmsg_debug( " distance to child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
311 
312  // if the current distance is less than the current minimum distance replace the current minimum distance with the current distance
313  if( tDistance < fChildSpaceDistance )
314  {
315  fChildSpaceDistance = tDistance;
316  }
317 
318  // if this distance is greater than the trajectory radius, skip the child space
319  if( tDistance > aTrajectoryRadius )
320  {
321  navmsg_debug( " skipping child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> because distance is greater than trajectory radius" << eom );
322  continue;
323  }
324 
325  // calculate initial intersection
326  tInitialIntersection = ( tInitialPoint - tSpace->Point( tInitialPoint )).Dot( tSpace->Normal( tInitialPoint ) );
327  navmsg_debug( " initial intersection to child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tInitialIntersection << ">" << eom );
328 
329  // calculate final intersection
330  tFinalIntersection = ( tFinalPoint - tSpace->Point( tFinalPoint )).Dot( tSpace->Normal( tFinalPoint ) );
331  navmsg_debug( " final intersection to child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tFinalIntersection << ">" << eom );
332 
333 
334  if( tFinalIntersection <= 0 )
335  {
336  //final state inside, default case for enter
337  //including zero intersection function, if final state hits exactly the border of the space to enter (very rare case)
338 
339  double tLowerBoundary = 0.0;
340  if( tInitialIntersection <= 0 )
341  {
342  //very rare case where the space was just left and the initial state of the next step is still inside due to numerics
343  //increase the lower boundary to make sure not to get two intersections (which would results in gsl error for brent solver)
344  tLowerBoundary = aTrajectoryStep / 100.0;
345  }
346 
347  // calculate intersection time
348  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSpace( tSpace );
349  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SpaceIntersectionFunction, 0., tLowerBoundary, aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
350  navmsg_debug( " time to child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
351  }
352  else
353  {
354  //final state outside, particle did not enter space (or step size is to large!)
355  navmsg_debug( " skipping child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> because final intersection function is positive" << eom );
356  continue;
357  }
358 
359  // if the intersection time is not the smallest, skip the child space
360  if( tTime > tSpaceTime )
361  {
362  navmsg_debug( " skipping child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> because intersection time is not smallest" << eom );
363  continue;
364  }
365 
366 #ifdef Kassiopeia_ENABLE_DEBUG
367  // calculate intersection distance
368  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tTime, fIntermediateParticle );
369  tDistance = (fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() - tSpace->Point( fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() )).Magnitude();
370  navmsg_debug( " distance of calculated crossing position to child space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
371 #endif
372 
373  tSpaceFlag = true;
374  tSpaceTime = tTime;
375  fParentSpace = NULL;
376  fChildSpace = tSpace;
377  }
378 
379  fChildSpaceRecalculate = false;
380  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to child spaces is <" << fChildSpaceDistance << ">" << eom );
381  }
382 
383  //************
384  //parent sides
385  //************
386 
387  if( fParentSideRecalculate == false )
388  {
389  double tExcursion = (aTrajectoryCenter - fParentSideAnchor).Magnitude() + aTrajectoryRadius;
390  if( tExcursion >= fParentSideDistance )
391  {
392  navmsg_debug( " excursion from parent side anchor exceeds cached distance <" << fParentSideDistance << ">" << eom );
393 
394  fParentSideRecalculate = true;
395  }
396  }
397  if( fParentSideRecalculate == true )
398  {
399  fParentSideAnchor = aTrajectoryCenter;
400  fParentSideDistance = numeric_limits< double >::max();
401  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to parent sides must be recalculated" << eom );
402 
403  for( int tParentSideIndex = 0; tParentSideIndex < tCurrentSpace->GetSideCount(); tParentSideIndex++ )
404  {
405  tSide = tCurrentSpace->GetSide( tParentSideIndex );
406 
407  // calculate the distance between the anchor and the parent side
408  tDistance = (fParentSideAnchor - tSide->Point( fParentSideAnchor )).Magnitude();
409  navmsg_debug( " distance to parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
410 
411  // if the current distance is less than the current minimum distance replace the current minimum distance with the current distance
412  if( tDistance < fParentSideDistance )
413  {
414  fParentSideDistance = tDistance;
415  }
416 
417  // if this distance is greater than the trajectory radius, skip the parent side
418  if( tDistance > aTrajectoryRadius )
419  {
420  navmsg_debug( " skipping parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> because distance is greater than trajectory radius" << eom );
421  continue;
422  }
423 
424  // calculate initial intersection
425  tInitialIntersection = ( tInitialPoint - tSide->Point( tInitialPoint )).Dot( tSide->Normal( tInitialPoint ) );
426  navmsg_debug( " initial intersection to parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tInitialIntersection << ">" << eom );
427 
428  // calculate final intersection
429  tFinalIntersection = ( tFinalPoint - tSide->Point( tFinalPoint )).Dot( tSide->Normal( tFinalPoint ) );
430  navmsg_debug( " final intersection to parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tFinalIntersection << ">" << eom );
431 
432  if( tFinalIntersection < 0 )
433  {
434  //final state is inside current space, no exit, skipping
435  navmsg_debug( " skipping parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> because final intersection function sign is negative" << eom );
436  continue;
437  }
438  else if( tFinalIntersection > 0 )
439  {
440  //initial state inside, final state outside, default case for exiting
441 
442  double tLowerBoundary = 0.0;
443  if( tInitialIntersection > 0 )
444  {
445  // rare case that only happens if the space was just entered but the initial intersection is not zero but positive due to numerics
446  // and the space is smaller than the step size
447  // as two intersections exist for this case, the lower boundary is increased a little bit to get the second intersection,
448  // which is where the particle leaves the space
449  tLowerBoundary = aTrajectoryStep / 100.0;
450  }
451  // calculate intersection time
452  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSide( tSide );
453  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SideIntersectionFunction, 0., tLowerBoundary, aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
454  navmsg_debug( " time to parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
455  }
456  else if( tFinalIntersection == 0 )
457  {
458  //final state exactly on border of parent space, very rare case for exiting
459  tTime = aTrajectoryStep;
460  navmsg_debug( " time to parent space <" << tSpace->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
461  }
462 
463 
464  // calculate intersection time
465  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSide( tSide );
466  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SideIntersectionFunction, 0., 0., aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
467  navmsg_debug( " time to parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
468 
469  // if the intersection time is not the smallest, skip the parent side
470  if( tTime > tSideTime )
471  {
472  navmsg_debug( " skipping parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> because intersection time is not smallest" << eom );
473  continue;
474  }
475 
476 #ifdef Kassiopeia_ENABLE_DEBUG
477  // calculate intersection distance
478  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tTime, fIntermediateParticle );
479  tDistance = (fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() - tSide->Point( fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() )).Magnitude();
480  navmsg_debug( " distance of calculated crossing position to parent side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
481 #endif
482 
483  tSideFlag = true;
484  tSideTime = tTime;
485  fParentSide = tSide;
486  fChildSide = NULL;
487  }
488 
489  fParentSideRecalculate = false;
490  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to parent sides is <" << fParentSideDistance << ">" << eom );
491  }
492 
493  //***********
494  //child sides
495  //***********
496 
497  if( fChildSideRecalculate == false )
498  {
499  double tExcursion = (aTrajectoryCenter - fChildSideAnchor).Magnitude() + aTrajectoryRadius;
500  if( tExcursion >= fChildSideDistance )
501  {
502  navmsg_debug( " excursion from child side anchor exceeds cached distance <" << fChildSideDistance << ">" << eom );
503 
504  fChildSideRecalculate = true;
505  }
506  }
507  if( fChildSideRecalculate == true )
508  {
509  fChildSideAnchor = aTrajectoryCenter;
510  fChildSideDistance = numeric_limits< double >::max();
511  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to child sides must be recalculated" << eom );
512 
513  for( int tSpaceIndex = 0; tSpaceIndex < tCurrentSpace->GetSpaceCount(); tSpaceIndex++ )
514  {
515  tSpace = tCurrentSpace->GetSpace( tSpaceIndex );
516  for( int tInternalSideIndex = 0; tInternalSideIndex < tSpace->GetSideCount(); tInternalSideIndex++ )
517  {
518  tSide = tSpace->GetSide( tInternalSideIndex );
519 
520  // calculate the distance between the anchor and the child side
521  tDistance = (fChildSideAnchor - tSide->Point( fChildSideAnchor )).Magnitude();
522  navmsg_debug( " distance to child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
523 
524  // if the current distance is less than the current minimum distance replace the current minimum distance with the current distance
525  if( tDistance < fChildSideDistance )
526  {
527  fChildSideDistance = tDistance;
528  }
529 
530  // if this distance is greater than the trajectory radius, skip the child side
531  if( tDistance > aTrajectoryRadius )
532  {
533  navmsg_debug( " skipping child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> because distance is greater than trajectory radius" << eom );
534  continue;
535  }
536 
537  // calculate initial intersection
538  tInitialIntersection = ( tInitialPoint - tSide->Point( tInitialPoint )).Dot( tSide->Normal( tInitialPoint ) );
539  navmsg_debug( " initial intersection to child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tInitialIntersection << ">" << eom );
540 
541  // calculate final intersection
542  tFinalIntersection = ( tFinalPoint - tSide->Point( tFinalPoint )).Dot( tSide->Normal( tFinalPoint ) );
543  navmsg_debug( " final intersection to child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tFinalIntersection << ">" << eom );
544 
545 
546  if( tFinalIntersection <= 0 )
547  {
548  //final state inside, default case for enter
549  //including zero intersection function, if final state hits exactly the side of the space to enter (very rare case)
550 
551  double tLowerBoundary = 0.0;
552  if( tInitialIntersection <= 0 )
553  {
554  //very rare case where the space was just left and the initial state of the next step is still inside due to numerics
555  //increase the lower boundary to make sure not to get two intersections (which would results in gsl error for brent solver)
556  tLowerBoundary = aTrajectoryStep / 100.0;
557  }
558 
559  // calculate intersection time
560  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSide( tSide );
561  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SideIntersectionFunction, 0., tLowerBoundary, aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
562  navmsg_debug( " time to child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
563  }
564  else
565  {
566  //final state outside, particle did not enter space/side
567  navmsg_debug( " skipping child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> because final intersection function is positive" << eom );
568  continue;
569  }
570 
571  // if the intersection time is not the smallest, skip the child side
572  if( tTime > tSideTime )
573  {
574  navmsg_debug( " skipping child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> because intersection time is not smallest" << eom );
575  continue;
576  }
577 
578 #ifdef Kassiopeia_ENABLE_DEBUG
579  // calculate intersection distance
580  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tTime, fIntermediateParticle );
581  tDistance = (fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() - tSide->Point( fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() )).Magnitude();
582  navmsg_debug( " distance of calculated crossing position to child side <" << tSide->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
583 #endif
584 
585  tSideFlag = true;
586  tSideTime = tTime;
587  fParentSide = NULL;
588  fChildSide = tSide;
589  }
590  }
591 
592  fChildSideRecalculate = false;
593  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to child sides is <" << fChildSideDistance << ">" << eom );
594  }
595 
596  //**************
597  //child surfaces
598  //**************
599 
600  if( fChildSurfaceRecalculate == false )
601  {
602  double tExcursion = (aTrajectoryCenter - fChildSurfaceAnchor).Magnitude() + aTrajectoryRadius;
603  if( tExcursion >= fChildSurfaceDistance )
604  {
605  fChildSurfaceRecalculate = true;
606 
607  navmsg_debug( " excursion from child surface anchor exceeds cached distance <" << fChildSurfaceDistance << ">" << eom );
608  }
609  }
610  if( fChildSurfaceRecalculate == true )
611  {
612  fChildSurfaceAnchor = aTrajectoryCenter;
613  fChildSurfaceDistance = numeric_limits< double >::max();
614  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to child surfaces must be recalculated" << eom );
615 
616  for( int tSurfaceIndex = 0; tSurfaceIndex < tCurrentSpace->GetSurfaceCount(); tSurfaceIndex++ )
617  {
618  tSurface = tCurrentSpace->GetSurface( tSurfaceIndex );
619 
620  // calculate the distance between the anchor and the child surface
621  tDistance = (fChildSurfaceAnchor - tSurface->Point( fChildSurfaceAnchor )).Magnitude();
622  navmsg_debug( " distance to child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
623 
624  // if the current distance is less than the current minimum distance replace the current minimum distance with the current distance
625  if( tDistance < fChildSurfaceDistance )
626  {
627  fChildSurfaceDistance = tDistance;
628  }
629 
630  // if this distance is greater than the trajectory radius, skip the child surface
631  if( tDistance > aTrajectoryRadius )
632  {
633  navmsg_debug( " skipping child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> because distance is greater than trajectory radius" << eom );
634  continue;
635  }
636 
637  // calculate initial intersection
638  tInitialIntersection = ( tInitialPoint - tSurface->Point( tInitialPoint )).Dot( tSurface->Normal( tInitialPoint ) );
639  navmsg_debug( " initial intersection to child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> is <" << tInitialIntersection << ">" << eom );
640 
641  // calculate final intersection
642  tFinalIntersection = ( tFinalPoint - tSurface->Point( tFinalPoint )).Dot( tSurface->Normal( tFinalPoint ) );
643  navmsg_debug( " final intersection to child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> is <" << tFinalIntersection << ">" << eom );
644 
645 
646  if ( tFinalIntersection == 0. )
647  {
648  //step hitting surface exactly, time is trajectory step
649  tTime = aTrajectoryStep;
650  navmsg_debug( " time to child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
651  }
652  else if ( tSurface == fLastStepSurface )
653  {
654  //we are starting on the surface, but if the trajectory is curved, we may cross the surface again with the same step
655  KThreeVector tMomentum = aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetMomentum();
656  KThreeVector tNormal = tSurface->Normal( aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetPosition() );
657 
658  if ( tMomentum.Dot( tNormal ) > 0. )
659  {
660  if ( tFinalIntersection <= 0. )
661  {
662  //particle turned around and crossed surface again
663  //find second crossing point (first one is at the start, increase lower boundary artificially
664  double tLowerBoundary = aTrajectoryStep / 100.0;
665  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSurface( tSurface );
666  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SurfaceIntersectionFunction, 0., tLowerBoundary, aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
667  navmsg_debug( " time to cross child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> again is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
668  }
669  else
670  {
671  navmsg_debug( " skipping child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> because it was crossed on last step" <<eom );
672  continue;
673  }
674  }
675  else
676  // tMommentum.Dot( tNormal ) < 0
677  {
678  if ( tFinalIntersection >= 0. )
679  {
680  //particle turned around and crossed surface again
681  //find second crossing point (first one is at the start, increase lower boundary artificially
682  double tLowerBoundary = aTrajectoryStep / 100.0;
683  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSurface( tSurface );
684  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SurfaceIntersectionFunction, 0., tLowerBoundary, aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
685  navmsg_debug( " time to cross child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> again is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
686  }
687  else
688  {
689  navmsg_debug( " skipping child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> because it was crossed on last step" <<eom );
690  continue;
691  }
692  }
693 
694  }
695  else if ( tInitialIntersection == 0.0 )
696  {
697  //starting exactly on surface, but it was not crossed before. The space was just entered or the simulation just started
698  navmsg_debug( " skipping child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> because initial particle state is exactly on surface (no crossing)" << eom );
699  continue;
700  }
701  else if ( (tInitialIntersection > 0. && tFinalIntersection < 0.)
702  || (tInitialIntersection < 0. && tFinalIntersection > 0.) )
703  {
704  //sign change in intersection function indicates crossing of surface (default case)
705 
706  // calculate intersection time
707  fIntermediateParticle.SetCurrentSurface( tSurface );
708  fSolver.Solve( KMathBracketingSolver::eBrent, this, &KSNavSpace::SurfaceIntersectionFunction, 0., 0., aTrajectoryStep, tTime );
709  navmsg_debug( " time to cross child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> is <" << tTime << ">" << eom );
710  }
711  else
712  {
713  //signs are the same, no crossing
714  navmsg_debug( " skipping child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> because intersection function signs are the same" << eom );
715  continue;
716  }
717 
718  // if the intersection time is not the smallest, skip the child surface
719  if( tTime > tSurfaceTime )
720  {
721  navmsg_debug( " skipping child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> because intersection time is not smallest" << eom );
722  continue;
723  }
724 
725 #ifdef Kassiopeia_ENABLE_DEBUG
726  // calculate intersection distance
727  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tTime, fIntermediateParticle );
728  tDistance = (fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() - tSurface->Point( fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition() )).Magnitude();
729  navmsg_debug( " distance of calculated crossing position to child surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << "> is <" << tDistance << ">" << eom );
730 #endif
731 
732  tSurfaceFlag = true;
733  tSurfaceTime = tTime;
734  fChildSurface = tSurface;
735  }
736 
737  fChildSurfaceRecalculate = false;
738  navmsg_debug( " minimum distance to child surfaces is <" << fChildSurfaceDistance << ">" << eom );
739  }
740 
741  //reset last step surface
742  fLastStepSurface = NULL;
743 
744  //******************
745  //case determination
746  //******************
747 
748  if( tSideFlag == true )
749  {
750  if( tSideTime < tSurfaceTime )
751  {
752  fChildSurface = NULL;
753  fParentSpace = NULL;
754  fChildSpace = NULL;
755 
756  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tSideTime, aNavigationParticle );
757  aNavigationStep = tSideTime;
758  aNavigationFlag = true;
759 
760  navmsg_debug( " particle may cross side" << eom );
761 
762  return;
763  }
764  }
765 
766  if( (tSurfaceFlag == true) || (tSpaceFlag == true) )
767  {
768  if( tSurfaceTime < tSpaceTime )
769  {
770  fParentSpace = NULL;
771  fChildSpace = NULL;
772 
773  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tSurfaceTime, aNavigationParticle );
774  aNavigationStep = tSurfaceTime;
775  aNavigationFlag = true;
776 
777  navmsg_debug( " particle may cross surface" << eom );
778 
779  return;
780  }
781  else
782  {
783  fChildSurface = NULL;
784 
785  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory( tSpaceTime, aNavigationParticle );
786  aNavigationStep = tSpaceTime;
787  aNavigationFlag = true;
788 
789  navmsg_debug( " particle may change space" << eom );
790 
791  return;
792  }
793  }
794 
795  aNavigationParticle = aTrajectoryFinalParticle;
796  aNavigationStep = aTrajectoryStep;
797  aNavigationFlag = false;
798 
799  navmsg_debug( " no navigation occurred" << eom );
800 
801  //check if the navigator is in the correct state next step
802  fSpaceInsideCheck = true;
803 
804  return;
805  }
806  void KSNavSpace::ExecuteNavigation( const KSParticle& aNavigationParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& aParticleQueue ) const
807  {
808  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> executing navigation:" << eom );
809 
810  //kill the particle if the navigation was wrong
811  if ( fNavigationFail )
812  {
813  fNavigationFail = false;
814  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
815  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
816  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "navigator_fail" );
817  aFinalParticle.SetActive( false );
818  return;
819  }
820  //do not perform a space check next step, as it may lead to wrong results in the step directly after a space change, when the particle is on a boundary (due to numerical errors)
821  fSpaceInsideCheck = false;
822 
823  if( fParentSpace != NULL )
824  {
825  navmsg( eNormal ) << " parent space <" << fParentSpace->GetName() << "> was exited" << eom;
826 
827  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
828  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
829  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fParentSpace->GetName() );
830  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "exit" );
831 
832  if( fExitSplit == true )
833  {
834  KSParticle* tExitSplitParticle = new KSParticle( aFinalParticle );
835  tExitSplitParticle->SetCurrentSpace( fParentSpace->GetParent() );
836  tExitSplitParticle->SetCurrentSurface( NULL );
837  tExitSplitParticle->SetCurrentSide( NULL );
838  tExitSplitParticle->ResetFieldCaching();
839  aParticleQueue.push_back( tExitSplitParticle );
840  aFinalParticle.SetActive( false );
841  }
842 
843  return;
844  }
845 
846  if( fChildSpace != NULL )
847  {
848  navmsg( eNormal ) << " child space <" << fChildSpace->GetName() << "> was entered" << eom;
849 
850  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
851  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
852  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fChildSpace->GetName() );
853  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "enter" );
854 
855  if( fEnterSplit == true )
856  {
857  KSParticle* tEnterSplitParticle = new KSParticle( aFinalParticle );
858  tEnterSplitParticle->SetCurrentSpace( fChildSpace );
859  tEnterSplitParticle->SetCurrentSurface( NULL );
860  tEnterSplitParticle->SetCurrentSide( NULL );
861  tEnterSplitParticle->ResetFieldCaching();
862  aParticleQueue.push_back( tEnterSplitParticle );
863  aFinalParticle.SetActive( false );
864  }
865 
866  return;
867  }
868 
869  if( fParentSide != NULL )
870  {
871  navmsg( eNormal )<< " parent side <" << fParentSide->GetName() << "> was crossed" << eom;
872 
873  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
874  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
875  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fParentSide->GetName() );
876  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "crossed" );
877  return;
878  }
879 
880  if( fChildSide != NULL )
881  {
882  navmsg( eNormal ) << " child side <" << fChildSide->GetName() << "> was crossed" << eom;
883 
884  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
885  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
886  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fChildSide->GetName() );
887  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "crossed" );
888  return;
889  }
890 
891  if( fChildSurface != NULL )
892  {
893  navmsg( eNormal ) << " child surface <" << fChildSurface->GetName() << "> was crossed" << eom;
894 
895  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
896  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
897  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fChildSurface->GetName() );
898  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "crossed" );
899  return;
900  }
901 
902  navmsg( eError ) << "could not determine space navigation" << eom;
903  return;
904  }
905 
906  void KSNavSpace::FinalizeNavigation( KSParticle& aFinalParticle ) const
907  {
908  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> finalizing navigation:" << eom );
909 
910  if( fParentSpace != NULL )
911  {
912  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for exiting of parent space <" << fParentSpace->GetName() << "> " << eom );
913 
914  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSpace( fParentSpace->GetParent() );
915  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
916  fParentSpace->Exit();
917  fParentSpace = NULL;
918  return;
919  }
920 
921  if( fChildSpace != NULL )
922  {
923  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for entering of child space <" << fChildSpace->GetName() << "> " << eom );
924 
925  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSpace( fChildSpace );
926  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
927  fChildSpace->Enter();
928  fChildSpace = NULL;
929  return;
930  }
931 
932  if( fParentSide != NULL )
933  {
934  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for crossing of parent side <" << fParentSide->GetName() << "> " << eom );
935 
936  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSide( fParentSide );
937  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
938  fParentSide->On();
939  fParentSide = NULL;
940  return;
941  }
942 
943  if( fChildSide != NULL )
944  {
945  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for crossing of child side <" << fChildSide->GetName() << "> " << eom );
946 
947  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSide( fChildSide );
948  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
949  fChildSide->On();
950  fChildSide = NULL;
951  return;
952  }
953 
954  if( fChildSurface != NULL )
955  {
956  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for crossing of child surface <" << fChildSurface->GetName() << "> " << eom );
957 
958  fLastStepSurface = fChildSurface;
959  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSurface( fChildSurface );
960  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
961  fChildSurface->On();
962  fChildSurface = NULL;
963  return;
964  }
965 
966  navmsg( eError ) << "could not finalize space navigation" << eom;
967  return;
968  }
969 
970  void KSNavSpace::StartNavigation( KSParticle& aParticle, KSSpace* aRoot )
971  {
972  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> starting navigation:" << eom );
973 
974  // reset navigation
975  fCurrentSpace = NULL;
976  fParentSideRecalculate = true;
977  fChildSideRecalculate = true;
978  fChildSurfaceRecalculate = true;
979  fParentSpaceRecalculate = true;
980  fChildSpaceRecalculate = true;
981 
982  if( aParticle.GetCurrentSpace() == NULL )
983  {
984  navmsg_debug( " computing fresh initial state" << eom );
985 
986  int tIndex = 0;
987  KSSpace* tParentSpace = aRoot;
988  KSSpace* tSpace = NULL;
989  while( tIndex < tParentSpace->GetSpaceCount() )
990  {
991  tSpace = tParentSpace->GetSpace( tIndex );
992  if( tSpace->Outside( aParticle.GetPosition() ) == false )
993  {
994  navmsg_debug( " activating space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
995 
996  tSpace->Enter();
997  tParentSpace = tSpace;
998  tIndex = 0;
999  }
1000  else
1001  {
1002  navmsg_debug( " skipping space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1003 
1004  tIndex++;
1005  }
1006  }
1007 
1008  aParticle.SetCurrentSpace( tParentSpace );
1009  }
1010  else
1011  {
1012  navmsg_debug( " entering given initial state" << eom );
1013 
1014  KSSpace* tSpace = aParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
1015  KSSurface* tSurface = aParticle.GetCurrentSurface();
1016  KSSide* tSide = aParticle.GetCurrentSide();
1017  deque< KSSpace* > tSequence;
1018 
1019  // get into the correct space state
1020  while( tSpace != aRoot )
1021  {
1022  tSequence.push_front( tSpace );
1023  tSpace = tSpace->GetParent();
1024  }
1025  for( deque< KSSpace* >::iterator tIt = tSequence.begin(); tIt != tSequence.end(); tIt++ )
1026  {
1027  tSpace = *tIt;
1028 
1029  navmsg_debug( " entering space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1030 
1031  tSpace->Enter();
1032  }
1033 
1034  fLastStepSurface = aParticle.GetLastStepSurface();
1035 
1036  if ( tSurface != NULL )
1037  {
1038  navmsg_debug( " activating surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1039 
1040  tSurface->On();
1041  }
1042 
1043  if ( tSide != NULL )
1044  {
1045  navmsg_debug( " activating side <" << tSide->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1046 
1047  tSide->On();
1048  }
1049  }
1050 
1051  return;
1052  }
1053  void KSNavSpace::StopNavigation( KSParticle& aParticle, KSSpace* aRoot )
1054  {
1055  // reset navigation
1056  fCurrentSpace = NULL;
1057  fParentSideRecalculate = true;
1058  fChildSideRecalculate = true;
1059  fChildSurfaceRecalculate = true;
1060  fParentSpaceRecalculate = true;
1061  fChildSpaceRecalculate = true;
1062 
1063  fParentSpace = NULL;
1064  fChildSpace = NULL;
1065  fParentSide = NULL;
1066  fChildSide = NULL;
1067  fChildSurface = NULL;
1068  fLastStepSurface = NULL;
1069 
1070  deque< KSSpace* > tSpaces;
1071  KSSpace* tSpace = aParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
1072  KSSurface* tSurface = aParticle.GetCurrentSurface();
1073  KSSide* tSide = aParticle.GetCurrentSide();
1074 
1075  // undo side state
1076  if( tSide != NULL )
1077  {
1078  navmsg_debug( " deactivating side <" << tSide->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1079 
1080  tSide->Off();
1081  }
1082 
1083  // undo surface state
1084  if( tSurface != NULL )
1085  {
1086  navmsg_debug( " deactivating surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1087 
1088  tSurface->Off();
1089  }
1090 
1091  // undo space state
1092  while( tSpace != aRoot )
1093  {
1094  tSpaces.push_back( tSpace );
1095  tSpace = tSpace->GetParent();
1096  }
1097  for( deque< KSSpace* >::iterator tIt = tSpaces.begin(); tIt != tSpaces.end(); tIt++ )
1098  {
1099  tSpace = *tIt;
1100 
1101  navmsg_debug( " deactivating space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1102 
1103  tSpace->Exit();
1104  }
1105 
1106  return;
1107  }
1108 
1109 
1110  double KSNavSpace::SpaceIntersectionFunction( const double& aTime )
1111  {
1112  fCurrentTrajectory->ExecuteTrajectory( aTime, fIntermediateParticle );
1113  KThreeVector tParticlePoint = fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition();
1114  KThreeVector tSpacePoint = fIntermediateParticle.GetCurrentSpace()->Point( tParticlePoint );
1115  KThreeVector tSpaceNormal = fIntermediateParticle.GetCurrentSpace()->Normal( tParticlePoint );
1116  return (tParticlePoint - tSpacePoint).Dot( tSpaceNormal );
1117  }
1118  double KSNavSpace::SurfaceIntersectionFunction( const double& aTime )
1119  {
1120  fCurrentTrajectory->ExecuteTrajectory( aTime, fIntermediateParticle );
1121  KThreeVector tParticlePoint = fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition();
1122  KThreeVector tSurfacePoint = fIntermediateParticle.GetCurrentSurface()->Point( tParticlePoint );
1123  KThreeVector tSurfaceNormal = fIntermediateParticle.GetCurrentSurface()->Normal( tParticlePoint );
1124  return (tParticlePoint - tSurfacePoint).Dot( tSurfaceNormal );
1125  }
1126  double KSNavSpace::SideIntersectionFunction( const double& aTime )
1127  {
1128  fCurrentTrajectory->ExecuteTrajectory( aTime, fIntermediateParticle );
1129  KThreeVector tParticlePoint = fIntermediateParticle.GetPosition();
1130  KThreeVector tSidePoint = fIntermediateParticle.GetCurrentSide()->Point( tParticlePoint );
1131  KThreeVector tSideNormal = fIntermediateParticle.GetCurrentSide()->Normal( tParticlePoint );
1132  return (tParticlePoint - tSidePoint).Dot( tSideNormal );
1133  }
1134 
1135 }
